summary: This module provides the functionality to configure and manage Task Listeners and Task Schedulers. Task Listeners and Task Schedulers can be used to perform tasks periodically.
description:
Module Overview

This module provides the functionality to configure and manage Task Listeners and Task Schedulers. Task Listeners and Task Schedulers can be used to perform tasks periodically.

Task Listeners

A Task Listener can be used to create a service listener, which will be triggered at specified times.

Below are the two types of configurations that can be used to configure a Task Listener, either as a timer or as an appointment.

  • TimerConfiguration
  • AppointmentConfiguration

Task Listener as a Timer

The TimerConfiguration can be used to configure a task that needs to be executed periodically.

The following code snippet shows how to create a listener, which registers a task with an initial delay of 3000 milliseconds and is executed every 1000 milliseconds for 10 times.

task:TimerConfiguration timerConfiguration = {
    intervalInMillis: 1000,
    initialDelayInMillis: 3000,
    // Number of recurrences will limit the number of times the timer runs.
    noOfRecurrences: 10
};

listener task:Listener timer = new(timerConfiguration);

// Creating a service on the `timer` task Listener.
service timerService on timer {
    // This resource triggers when the timer goes off.
    resource function onTrigger() {
    }
}

For an example on the usage of the task:Listener as a timer, see the Task Service Timer Example.

Task Listener as an Appointment

The AppointmentConfiguration can be used to schedule an appointment.

The following code snippet shows how to create a task appointment, which registers a service using a CRON expression to execute the task every second for 10 times.

task:AppointmentConfiguration appointmentConfiguration = {
    // This cron expression will schedule the appointment once every second.
    appointmentDetails: "* * * * * ?",
    // Number of recurrences will limit the number of times the timer runs.
    noOfRecurrences: 10
};

listener task:Listener appointment = new(appointmentConfiguration);

// Creating a service on the `appointment` task Listener.
service appointmentService on appointment {
    // This resource triggers when the appointment is due.
    resource function onTrigger() {
    }
}

For an example on the usage of the task:Listener as an appointment, see the Task Service Appointment Example.

Task Schedulers

A Task Scheduler can be used to create timers/appointments dynamically. Service(s) can be attached to the Scheduler so that they can be invoked when the Scheduler is triggered.

Similar to Task Listeners, below are the two types of configurations that can be used to configure a Task Scheduler either as a timer or as an appointment.

  • TimerConfiguration
  • AppointmentConfiguration

Task Scheduler as a Timer

A Scheduler can be used to create timers via its TimerConfiguration.

The following code snippet shows how to create a task:Scheduler as a timer.

task:TimerConfiguration timerConfiguration = {
        intervalInMillis: 1000,
        initialDelayInMillis: 0,
        noOfRecurrences: 10
};
task:Scheduler timer = new(timerConfiguration);

For an example on the usage of the task:Scheduler as a timer, see the Task Scheduler Timer Example.

Task Scheduler as an Appointment

A Scheduler can also be used to create appointments via its AppointmentConfiguration.

The following code snippet shows how to create a Task Scheduler as an appointment.

task:AppointmentConfiguration appointmentConfiguration = {
        appointmentDetails: "* * * * * ?",
        noOfRecurrences: 10
};
task:Scheduler appointment = new(appointmentConfiguration);

For an example on the usage of the task:Scheduler as an appointment, see the Task Scheduler Appointment Example.

fields.name: appointmentDetails
fields.description: A CRON expression as a string or task:AppointmentData for scheduling an appointment

fields.name: noOfRecurrences
fields.description: Number of times to trigger the task after which the task stops running

records.name: AppointmentConfiguration
records.description: Configurations related to an appointment, which are used to define the behavior of an appointment when initializing the task:Listener.

fields.name: seconds
fields.description: Second(s) in a given minute in which the appointment will run

fields.name: minutes
fields.description: Minute(s) in a given hour in which the appointment will run

fields.name: hours
fields.description: Hour(s) in a given day in which the appointment will run

fields.name: daysOfMonth
fields.description: Day(s) of the month in which the appointment will run

fields.name: months
fields.description: Month(s) in a given year in which the appointment will run

fields.name: daysOfWeek
fields.description: Day(s) of a week in which the appointment will run

fields.name: year
fields.description: Year(s) in which the appointment will run

records.name: AppointmentData
records.description: The CRON expression required for scheduling an appointment.

fields.name: intervalInMillis
fields.description: Timer interval (in milliseconds), which triggers the onTrigger resource

fields.name: initialDelayInMillis
fields.description: Delay (in milliseconds) after which the timer will run

fields.name: noOfRecurrences
fields.description: Number of times to trigger the task after which the task stops running

records.name: TimerConfiguration
records.description: Configurations related to a timer, which are used to define the behavior of a timer when initializing the task:Listener.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The task:TimerConfiguration or task:AppointmentConfiguration record to define the task:Sceduler behavior

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes a task:Scheduler object. This may panic if the initialization causes any error due to a configuration error.

parameters.name: serviceToAttach
parameters.description: Ballerina service object, which needs to be attached to the task

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: Set of optional parameters, which need to be passed inside the resources

returnParameters.description: A task:SchedulerError if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

parameters.name: attachedService
parameters.description: Ballerina service object, which needs to be detached from the task

returnParameters.description: A task:SchedulerError if the process failed due to any reason or else ()
A task:SchedulerError if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts running the task. Task Scheduler will not run until this has been called.

returnParameters.description: A task:SchedulerError if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the task. This will stop after running the existing jobs.

returnParameters.description: A task:SchedulerError if an error is occurred while pausing or else ()
A task:SchedulerError when an error occurred while resuming or else ()
true if the Scheduler is already started or else false if the Scheduler is not started yet or stopped calling the Scheduler.stop() function

methods.name: isStarted
methods.description: Checks whether the task listener is started or not.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The task:TimerConfiguration or task:AppointmentConfiguration record to define the task:Sceduler behavior

objects.name: Scheduler
objects.description: Represents a ballerina task Scheduler, which can be used to run jobs periodically, using the given configurations.

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to attach the service

lifeCycleMethods.name: __attach
lifeCycleMethods.description: Attaches the given service to the task:Listener. This may panic if the service attachment is fails.

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to start the listener

lifeCycleMethods.name: __start
lifeCycleMethods.description: Starts dispatching the services attached to the task:Listener. This may panic if the service dispatching causes any error.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The task:TimerConfiguration or task:AppointmentConfiguration record to define the task:Listener behavior

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the task:Listener object. This may panic if the initialization is failed due to a configuration error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to attach the service

methods.name: __attach
methods.description: Attaches the given service to the task:Listener. This may panic if the service attachment is fails.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to detach the service
() or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to start the listener

methods.name: __start
methods.description: Starts dispatching the services attached to the task:Listener. This may panic if the service dispatching causes any error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: __gracefulStop
methods.description: Stops the task:Listener and the attached services gracefully. It will wait if there are any tasks still to be completed. This may panic if the stopping causes any error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: __immediateStop
methods.description: Stops the task:Listener and the attached services immediately. This will cancel any ongoing tasks. This may panic if the stopping causes any error.

returnParameters.description: A task:ListenerError if an error occurred while pausing or else ()
A task:ListenerError if an error occurred while resuming or else ()

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes a paused task:Listener. Calling this on an already-running task:Listener will not cause any error.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The task:TimerConfiguration or task:AppointmentConfiguration record to define the task:Listener behavior

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to detach the service
() or else a task:ListenerError upon failure to stop the listener

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents a ballerina task listener, which can be used to schedule and execute tasks periodically.

errors.name: ListenerError
errors.description: Error type specific to the task:Listener object functions.

errors.name: SchedulerError
errors.description: Error type specific to the task:Scheduler object functions.

unionTypes.name: Error
unionTypes.description: Represents the Union error type of the ballerina/task module. This error type represents any error that can occur during the execution of task APIs.
